title: Riot, please add diversity by adding items, not removing them.
body:
Keep the old items (except for the problem items, such as DFG. Although I think DFG could have just been nerfed extremely hard, so that it wasnt such a problem)

 Alot of the times, you guys remove great items (such as old zekes) and place a new item. It would be alot cooler if we had both items. I actually used old Zekes ALOT when we had 5 ad. It is a great item for 5 ad comps. 

Why remove diversity? It is a horrible decision. The new juggernaut items are a step in the right direction, because they added new items, while still keeping the old ones.  When you remake ADCs, please dont remove old items, thank you.

replies.body: The coolest result imo would be that we find all the existing items a home, in addition to adding new ones every now and again. However, I will say that it's not always super easy to actually find those items their home. Ohmwrecker and Zz'rot Portal, as examples, haven't really ever caught on or been seen as effective, so in the case of items that just don't ever catch on, I do think that both removal or continued support are viable options. Removal may sound like an unpopular opinion in these cases, but it's important to keep in mind that continued support of such items does come at the cost of something else, like creating new items.

1) The reason no one buys Ohmwrecker is because it isn't slot efficient in an end-game 6 item build. ALL the other bruiser items (Randuins, Frozen Heart, Cleaver, fuck even the new items) are slot efficient stat-wise without their passives and actives. Ohmwrecker is not, meaning if you don't actually have a situation pop up where the active is worth it... You just sacrificed a ton of stats for no reason. If you increased its cost and gave it more armor and HP, or even gave it 20% CDR instead of 10% instead, you can bet people would build it because the stats would actually be good. As it is now, it's basically a support item, because you're buying it EXCLUSIVELY for the active, and only supports can afford to sacrifice stats to do that. And supports have better options they can buy to turn a fight, some of which even give auras to their team: {{item:3023}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3060}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3190}} . So why would a support buy Ohmwrecker with all these other better options? And a bruiser never ever will, because the stats suck.

2) Zz'Rot is a great item. The reason it's not used is because it requires a specific laning strategy, and most people don't know how to (or don't want to) change their strategy to use the item properly. I personally LOVE Zz'Rot Garen. If I complete my Zz'Rot with my turret still having 50% or more of its hp, my turret will stand until one of 2 things happen: 1) I intentionally abandon my lane to take other turrets, or 2) I get 3 man ganked. If this item ever gets picked in pro-play, and a pro shows people how to actually use the item, you can BET its pick-rate will skyrocket. Guaranteed. It's an amazing item. Most people just prefer to buy combat stats (AD or AP) to kill their lane opponent. Some people don't like forcing their opponent under their turret by passively pushing, without being able to kill them unless they fuck up (and by fuck up I mean this: they take a ton of minion damage trying to kill you because your Zz'Rot killed all their minions, and yours are still alive). It's the same reason Nasus has a 6% pick-rate, but Riven has a 16% pick-rate: people want to kill shit; they don't want to be a passive asshole all game. That doesn't make it a bad item. It makes it a unique item that fits a specific playstyle. Unlike Ohmwrecker, there are actually people who buy Zz'Rot almost every game, and try to make guides on how to use it and inform the community about how broken it is. But those people aren't pros, so it never catches on. Also, unlike Ohmwrecker, it actually has good stats.

{{item:3056}} What if it just gave a automatic +20 MS?

{{item:3512}} Same with this one.

They both give a weird +20 towards turrets but that's not very useful unless you're near one and... then what? Not even staying near the turret is useful with either item unless its used but then you wait for a long time for its reactivation.

I'm not sure about Ohmwrecker (since it's a siege weapon), but the current speed bonus on Zz'Rot fits its purpose (splitpushing asshole), and is very easy to utilize.

Example situation:

I'm Garen, and I'm pushing the enemy's inner turret with my Zz'Rot. 3 or 4 people come to stop me. I retreat.

As long as I make an effort to retreat toward turrets (start my retreat by running toward the enemy's fallen outer turret, and then run toward my outer, inner, and inhibitor turrets) you maintain an almost permanent 20% movespeed bonus. It's actually REALLY really good - IF you're splitpushing. I have outrun so many people by doing this.

Like I said, Zz'Rot changes your ENTIRE playstyle. That's why people don't like it, but also why it's still an amazing item. You don't retreat and take shortcuts through the jungle when you splitpush with Zz'Rot. You run toward the turrets to get your speed boost - and it works. Oh does it ever work. I have had people blow flash and still not get me.

+20 movespeed would actually be a nerf. Like I said, Zz'Rot is actually **_COMPLETELY FINE AS IS._** Once it sees pro-play, people will pick it up. It's kind of a broken item. People just don't know how to use it.

Ohmwrecker, on the other hand, is garbage and needs buffs.
You make me want to use it now. (>•0•)>{{item:3512}}

I think Ohmwrecker could be decent if you add old Fortify effect to it. (Not global, just nearest ally tower within range.)
---

I play around with it sometimes when I have some breathing room in my build. It's OK on Rammus, Udyr, Malphite...anyone who can use/abuse the near tower movespeed, and uses the stats well. I feel like I buy it more for the passive and stats than the active. The active is **very** situational. And kind of get the feeling it's never like, you're at shop, thinking "What do I need?" AD? AP? Ar? Mr? Hp?
**OH WAIT, I NEEDA TOWERDIVE, RIGHT NOW...**
..while I'm in base...

It's just extremely hard to justify the purchase while you're in base, not knowing if you're going to be in a situation where you need to towerdive soon or not, and even further, a situation where you need to tower dive where deactivating the tower even matters. (Most times, even when I do use the active..I probably wouldn't have died to tower shots anyway. I just come out at 90% hp instead of 75% hp.)
There are some times where I think 'I really wish I had Ohmwrecker active right now, that guy would be sooo ded.'
But then if you recall, buy it, and get back there..the situation will be long LONG **LONG** gone, probably even if you have baron buffed recall and teleport, it'll still likely pass before you're back with the item.
And not likely to come up again, possibly for the rest of the game.

*BUT* being able to double up on the active, with a defensive option, means you'll be twice as likely to be in a situation where it's usable. While (possibly) not adding a whole lot to the power budget? (Unsure on that..maybe Fortify is insanely strong nowadays..don't know..haven't used it in years....) You could only use one or the other, it'd still go on cooldown, and you'll never be near enough to your own tower and enemy tower to get doubled down on it.
----

Zz'rot Portal on the other hand...I think even a Red said it feels like a win more card, that's not even as good as other win more cards, if it's a viable option, you've probably already won the game.

Add brawler minions to it, by way of enchantment (like boots and jungle items)
Possibly added to {{item:3060}} too.
No idea if that would fix anything with it, but it could be fun?
Would at least let you strategize with it a little bit. (EG: Do I need tank minions or ranged?)

Zeke's Herald wasn't the best of items, but it wasn't an issue and it was an item that can't be replaced by Harbinger.

Increasing the item count in the game is not the same thing as increasing diversity. 

The more and more items we have in the game, the more and more items that need to be considered in any given game, and items that aren't good will get pushed down the rabbit hole over better options. When that option gets buffed, it might just become the new best option. The reverse of that is also true: if one option is better than others, then there's no reason to build the other options, and when it gets nerfed it might become a bad option.

The more items you have, the more items that don't receive play this way. In a sense, adding items would actually decrease diversity by adding more options that are either ideal or suboptimal in nearly every situation.

A good example of this is with Runeglaive and Magus. Keep both items in, and the jungling champion pool gets decided on who can use which item better rather than them being used for their unique strengths. Same thing with Zeke's; everyone will just use the better item without giving consideration to the other item, and most people will choose Harbinger over Herald.
I can see what you mean, but maybe just adding/keeping more niche items would be better. Keeping both Zeke's would have been good because both are niche picks that can fit different scenarios.

They were both niche picks, but the niche for one was a situation where it shouldn't be good.

Where Zeke's Herald would be good over Zeke's Harbinger would be a full AD comp, which already isn't good, and Zeke's Herald won't change that.

An AD poke comp could be helped by building Herald. Jayce mid, Varus ADC, and someone like Rumble or Kennen top, or even Nid jungle, just someone who can punish enemies for stacking armor by shredding them.

3 of the 5 champions you just mentioned are completely AP based (just saying). Life steal doesn't apply to ability based damage, so running a Zeke's Herald in that comp would be pretty pointless. If you had a 5 ad team fight comp that included someone like Wukong for armor shred, then it's a little better I guess, but still not as useful as the 50% crit chance from Harbinger.
Edit: Also - vs. a poke comp it would be okay, it would allow ur team to sustain through the poke a little bit better, I guess.

You are a bit confused here, your argument is good but your examples are poor. Those items are exactly the issue here.

As you said yourself some Junglers would use Runeglaive others would use Magus. That is exactly "using them for their unique strength". And yes, the jungle champion pool get's decided by those items. That's the point. Both items support different AP junglers, so when you have both items in, the pool of available junglers becomes larger.

Also while everyone will get the better items, that only applies to items that can be compared in the first place. this doesn't apply to Zeke. Almost no one would take Harbinger over Herald as both items are vastly different, even more different than the two Hydras or the Spellblade items.
